notes: Additional Notes
MIDI interface; rhythm sequencer; function generators (LFOs);cv recorder
real time sequence phase offset/scrub via manual slider or CV; alternate operational mode as eight channel macro controller with reversible front panel
integrated quantizer channel; integrated four channel x0x-style trigger sequencer

gatelength: variable gate length per step; accent
notes: lots of internal modulation options

gatelength: gate on/off per step; global variable gate length
notes: requires external clock; dual clock inputs supports bi-directional clocking; cv and expanders available; chain two for 16 steps

track_outs: 1 cv, 1 gate (but there’s more to it than that)
gatelength: gate on/off per step or half-step length on/off per step
notes: combines eight step sequencing with bi-directional sequential switch functions, gate generation, and clock generation

gatelength: manual gate length knob; ch-2 pots control stage length in “parallel” mode
variable stage length per step (via third row of knobs), but no gate/trigger bus
notes: separate gate output at each step and clock output, but no real gate sequencing features; third row can control stage length; pairs with 962 Sequential Switch to create 16 or 24 step sequences
touchscreen UI; MIDI sequencer
extensive randomization features
cycle repeats; two gate buses

gatelength: pulse, ratchet, hold or pass-through per step
notes: analog; no built-in quantizer or storage

gatelength: trigger and/or gate on/off (three trigger buses) per step; variable gate length is available via expander
cv_ins: via expander: step address, start/end step, gate length, clock speed, playback direction
notes: analog; controller expander; glide features; no built-in quantizer or storage

gatelength: variable gate length per step, TBD
notes: quantized mutes; extensive MIDI support including recording; 2 octave “keyboard”

track_outs: 1 cv, 1 gate, 1 mod (assignable, including envelope generation)
gatelength: variable gate length per step, TBD
notes: MIDI support including recording; microtonal tunings; pattern chaining
open source/open hardware; swing; randomization

gatelength: variable gate length within variable step length per step; velocity
cv_ins: 2 assignable, plus assorted trigger inputs on expander
notes: extensive MIDI support including two additional MIDI-out-only tracks; chord sequencer; drum sequencer; expander adds more track outs and gate outs; built-in Launchpad support

tracks: up to 4 voices/mods (plus additional gate outs)
notes: MIDI capabilities; velocity; Euclidean patterns

gatelength: variable gate length within variable step length per step
notes: fully-independent tracks; cross-pattern looping; scale/root quantization; microtonal support; cv recording

gatelength: gate on/off per step; global gate length
notes: per step gate outputs; two units can be connected for various additional functionality

gatelength: gate on/off per step (three gate buses)
notes: MIDI clocking focus; unique gate timing features

product: Industrial Music Electronics Stillson Hammer Mk II
gatelength: variable gate length per step; delay
notes: per-step delay; cv outs can double as gate outs for up to 8-tracks of drum sequencing; *sliders do not always reflect state

gatelength: pulse, ratchet or hold per step
notes: shuffle; transpose

track_outs: 1 cv, 1 gate, plus assignable mod outputs
notes: eight subsequencers, probability and pitch manipulation features; gate expander

track_outs: 1 cv, 1 gate, plus many more depending on mode
notes: 4 position- and pressure-sensitive pads; per-step sequencing or real time recording/looping; chord generator; many other functions out of scope of this document

gatelength: variable gate length per step or per sequence
notes: basic semitone quantization available on-board

gatelength: pulse or pass-through per step (see notes)
notes: requires external clock; dual clock inputs supports dual-axis sequencing; more a gate processor than gate sequencer (conditionally generates pulses or passes through and merges externally-generated gates); separate aux cv output (arcane)
requires external clock(s); multiple clock inputs supports multi-axis sequencing; z-axis supports sequencing through states
provides additional six gate-only tracks; probability features; *sliders do not always reflect state
can be four gate channels, four cv channels, or 2 gate+cv channels; integrates with Varigate 8+ and Voltage Block

track_outs: 1 cv, 1 gate, plus extra per-step gate outs
notes: midi output; gated run control
faithful 303 sequencer recreation; accent output

gatelength: variable gate length within variable step length per step
notes: touchscreen UI (some users may need a stylus)
additional outputs per track available with expander; reliant on external QWERTY keyboard for programming (included)

gatelength: variable gate length per step, variable voltage/magnitude/velocity per step
cv_ins: 1 for pattern selection only; additional inputs through expander
notes: can be expanded to more channels; cv input expander

gatelength: gate on/off per step (two gate buses)
notes: multi-step “parallel loading” feature

gatelength: gate on/off per step; global gate length
notes: available in various different designs and multiple firmwares; requires external clock; includes other sequencing-related programs

gatelength: variable gate length within variable step length per step
cv_ins: various part selection, assignable modulation and cv recording options with ER-201 expander
notes: requires external clock; ER-102 expander adds addressable parts, CV modulation,  various CV recording features, and SD card storage
various playback modes, including self-transposition

cv_ins: transpose, various inputs for controlling and navigating pattern variations
notes: derives recursive, ephemeral, navigable melodic variations on a seed melodic pattern

gatelength: gate on/off per step; global gate length
notes: quantizer; special features when two Octones connected together
per step gate outs

videos: dB Velocity video overview|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0sur7IhRrBo; mdoudoroff operational video demo| https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CpAygAF5nE
notes: really an arbitrary function generator, but can be operated as a step sequencer

gatelength: hold, off, or various patterns per step
notes: MIDI clock and out; supports microtonal scales; can sort of do 16 step sequences by chaining the two tracks; also available DIY
extensive MIDI I/O features including recording; probability features
tracks can be configured for polyphonic or velocity/aftertouch use; midi/cv effects; MIDI interface; cv recording; arpeggio features
full piano roll sequencing at 96ppqn resolution; tracks can be configured for polyphonic or velocity/aftertouch use; midi/cv effects; MIDI interface; cv recording; arpeggio features

gatelength: gate on/off per step (two gate buses)
notes: glide feature; can run as two separate sequencers, one sequencer with two cv rows, or as a single 16-step sequencer

gatelength: gate on/off per step (two gate buses)
notes: slew feature; can run as two separate sequencers, one sequencer with two cv rows, or as a single 16-step sequencer; two external inputs for quantizer

notes: analog; no built-in quantizer; really an arbitrary function generator, but can be operated as a step sequencer

videos: Anthurium video demo series|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5jLsQil8mnU&list=PLkD7X9UnKyniZl3rbfV-Qby32t0m1N3hh&index=6; Cinematic Laboratory video series| https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f1Hh263Tp4s
notes: MIDI; modulation tracks; deep feature set
extensive random/probability features; MIDI expander available

sophisticated gate sequencer with cv track expander (4 channels per Voltera expander); note that gate and CV tracks are independent—Metron has 16 gate tracks, plus 16 accent tracks with the optional Axxent expander; up to 64 cv channels possible with additional Volteras; optional scale quantization
no built-in quantizer; two units can be chained with expander for 16 step sequences

cv_ins: transport, direction; more available through Ostankino expander module
notes: quantizer with optional just intonation; probability; preset storage; two units can be chained for 16 step sequencers; cv/ouptut expander with integration to XAOC’s Liebniz subsystem

gatelength: variable gate length within variable step length per step
notes: probability; additional CV output expanders; MIDI I/O with expander; subsequencers (tables); includes sample playback feature and synthesizer cartridge-based voice expanders; Launchpad and game controller support with expander
extensive arpeggio features; LFOs; tracks individually clockable; MIDI I/O
